column4: Microsoft women filed 238 discrimination and harassment complaints
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Women at Microsoft Corp working in U.S.-based technical jobs filed 238 internal complaints about gender discrimination or sexual harassment between 2010 and 2016  according to court filings made public on Monday.

column4: Apple  Google see reputation of corporate brands tumble in survey
column5: Apple Inc  and Alphabet Inc's Google  corporate brands dropped in an annual survey while Amazon.com Inc  maintained the top spot for the third consecutive year  and electric carmaker Telsa Inc  rocketed higher after sending a red Roadster into space.

column4: Apple  Google see reputation of corporate brands tumble in survey
column5: March 13 Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google corporate brands dropped in an annual survey while Amazon.com Inc maintained the top spot for the third consecutive year  and electric carmaker Telsa Inc rocketed higher after sending a red Roadster into space.

column4: Trump makes investment banking fees uncertain again
column5: President Donald Trump's dramatic intervention in Singapore-based Broadcom Ltd's  $117 billion hostile bid for U.S. semiconductor peer Qualcomm Inc  is the latest reminder to investment bankers not to take lucrative fees on transformative mergers for granted under his administration.

column4: Senate Democratic leader praises Trump's blocking Broadcom's takeover of Qualcomm
column5: WASHINGTON Senator Chuck Schumer  the top Democrat in the U.S. Senate  on Tuesday praised President Donald's Trump's decision to block chipmaker Broadcom Ltd's  proposed takeover of Qualcomm Inc   calling China's trade practices "rapacious."

column4: President Trump halts Broadcom takeover of Qualcomm
column5: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday blocked microchip maker Broadcom Ltd's proposed takeover of Qualcomm Inc on national security grounds  ending what would have been the technology industry's biggest deal ever amid concerns that it would give China the upper hand in mobile communications. | Video

column4: UPDATE 9-President Trump halts Broadcom takeover of Qualcomm
column5: March 12 U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday blocked microchip maker Broadcom Ltd's proposed takeover of Qualcomm Inc on national security grounds  ending what would have been the technology industry's biggest deal ever amid concerns that it would give China the upper hand in mobile communications.

column4: BRIEF-Qualcomm Says It Received Presidential Order To Abandon Proposed Takeover Of Co By Broadcom
column5: * RECEIVED A PRESIDENTIAL ORDER TO IMMEDIATELY AND PERMANENTLY ABANDON THE PROPOSED TAKEOVER OF QUALCOMM BY BROADCOM LIMITED
